str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come to life again, revive, regain life. To recover life.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From eu and phren; to put in a good frame of mind, i.e. Rejoice.
